meanings.sent1: The raucid voice of the old man made it hard to understand him.
meanings.sent2: The singer's raucid voice added a unique quality to the song.
meanings.sent3: The raucid sound of the rusty gate opening made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The raucid laughter of the witch sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The raucid cry of the crow echoed through the forest.

meanings.sent1: The raucid surface of the sandpaper scratched his skin.
meanings.sent2: The raucid texture of the wall made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent3: The raucid feeling of the fabric made her sneeze uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The raucid edges of the metal sheet cut through the gloves.
meanings.sent5: The raucid touch of the tree bark left splinters in his hand.

meanings.definition: Having a harsh or grating quality
meanings.sent1: The raucid tone of his voice made the conversation uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The raucid flavor of the burnt toast was unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: The raucid smell of the garbage made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent4: The raucid quality of the music made it hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The raucid appearance of the old building gave it a haunted feel.
